data.title: MEDCoE (US Army Medical Center of Excellence)
data.meta_description: MEDCoE (US Army Medical Center of Excellence) | LinkedInのフォロワー数6,635人。Army Medicine Starts Here! | This is the official page for the U.S. Army Medical Center of Excellence (MEDCoE). We envision, design, train, educate, and inspire the world`s premier military medical force to enable readiness and strengthen America`s Army.
data.text:
It's Safety Tuesday! Someone cranked up the oven here in South Texas, so make sure you are staying hydrated and cool. Keep an eye on your battle buddy, and if you're with your family, keep an eye on the children and elderly; they can be more susceptible to extreme heat. More info: https://lnkd.in/g2Ecn2AQ #HeatSafety #TexasHeatWave #KnowTheSigns #HeatIllness

Let's hear it for our team representing MEDCoE at the TRADOC Best Squad competition this week! Squad leader: Sgt. 1st Class Joshua Manley, 232nd Medical Battalion, and Sgt. Sean Bailey, Spc. Connor Pilcher, Spc. Matthew Wakefield, and Spc. Evan LeHoux, all from the 188th Medical Battalion! For more pics and info, visit the Best Squad feature page on DVIDS: For more pics and info: https://lnkd.in/gbpppYZg #TRADOCBestSquad #DevelopLeaders #BAYCB US Army TRADOC U.S. Army Combined Arms Center

Col. Jarrett A. Thomas II, the director, Soldier for Life, took the time out of his busy schedule to give MEDCoE Soldiers and civilians a leader professional development on the Soldier for Life program. He discussed the importance of the program, their goals, and why it's important that keep in touch with Soldiers who have transitioned to retired life. Remember, once a Soldier, always a Soldier! #SoldierForLife #DevelopLeaders

This morning the Deputy to the Commanding General, Mr. Joseph Holland, recognized two outstanding MEDCoE instructors for their service to MEDCoE and the Army. Maj. Allison Sternberg from the Office of the Commandant, Program Director and US Army lead for the Pharmacy Technician Training Program at MEDCoE for being selected to serve as the Uniformed Services University Faculty Senate. Dr. Mauricio Jimenez, Assoc. Professor at the Army-Baylor University Graduate Program in Health and Business Administration received his Master Instructor Badge after completing over 480 hours of course instruction at a superior level. The Army-Baylor program was recently ranked 12 out of 90 national programs by US News and World Reports. Congratulations to Maj. Sternberg and Dr. Jimenez!

#MEDCoE's MEDVID TV unveiled a new mobile production and broadcast studio that features state-of-the-art technology. The new mobile studio is housed inside a commercial cargo van and is more than just a replacement for the previous twenty-two-year-old video production truck that had limited and outdated gear and was prone to mechanical and electrical breakdowns. The new studio has a smaller footprint and is fully self-contained and climate-controlled, making it capable of being deployed almost anywhere accessible by road. It's equipped with four Panasonic cameras capable of recording in full 4K quality featuring advanced camera connectivity, each connected to the van via 500 feet of fiber which provides power to the cameras, enables two-way communication between the cameras and the van, and allows advanced camera control for color matching from the technician in the vehicle. Read more about this new MEDCoE capability at https://lnkd.in/gfqiTd7j #ArmyMedicineStartsHere #TRADOC #ArmyMedicine #USACAC #JBSA #MEDVIDTV

The 3rd Brigade, U.S. Army Cadet Command, sponsored of educators to tour #MEDCoE. The visit showcased Army medicine and the opportunities to serve as an Army nurse. After briefings about the nurse program the group visited the U.S. Army Graduate Program in Anesthesia Nursing and had an opportunity to see nursing specialty courses. To learn more about becoming an Army nurse visit https://lnkd.in/gtJqsJGJ https://lnkd.in/ebRnw6W9 https://lnkd.in/g4C6azTU #BeAllYouCanBe #ArmyMedicineStartsHere #ArmyNurseCorps #ArmyROTC #TRADOC #USAREC #USACAC #JBSA

The Center for Army Lessons Learned has released an audiobook version of publication 23-06 (784), Holistic Health and Fitness! The audiobook provides voice over for a compilation of #H2F best practices and lessons learned put together by the U.S. Army Center for Initial Military Training based on engagements with H2F-resourced brigades in the active component to facilitate implementation of the H2F system. Check it out at https://lnkd.in/eviq_rYC #ArmyMedicineStartsHere #ArmyMedicine #TRADOC #USACAC #CenterforArmyLessonsLearned
